Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LisaZ_NewJersey
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay in the Prenzlauer Berg area of Berlin during my stay and selected this hotel based on the reviews and photos on this site. I was not disappointed. While the hotel is a little "out of the way" from the main sites, there is a subway stop at the end of the street and the walk into the center of the city was an enjoyable one. It was nice to be in a residential area and I would definitely stay here again. The room was clean, spacious and updated. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. A definite value!

Reviews.Title: “A Berlin experience”
Reviews.Author: BernieBird
Reviews.Content: I had no expectation when booking this hotel but it was an interesting surprise. I guess you should go there is you want to experience a real Berlin building. The room lights and colors are sad but has huge volume. A very special atomosphere. I would recommend it if you just stay overnight (and for business) but not really for leisure. We were there on the 6th of December (well celebrated in Germany) and received a nice (and huge) chocolate gift.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: CharleyWood
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week at the beginning of December and I was impressed for the price I paid. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They speak English if you don't speak German. The hotel is in the Prenzauler Berg area - lots of cafes and resturants around and safe neighbourhood to walk around at night (I'm a single female and I wasn't scared). There is a U-bahn and a tram close by for easy access into Mitte and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Ample charm and warmth, but a refresh wouldn't hurt”
Reviews.Author: TwoForksintheRoad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Myer's Hotel many times and, perhaps I'm just getting weary, but this small, charming hotel - which has loads of potential - could use a bit of a refresh. All the ingredients are here - Myer's still has a great breakfast buffet - but I feel the hotel lately is missing something. Maybe I'm expecting too much - prices are reasonable, location terrific - but a bit of polish would be great. New bathrooms, carpeting, and bedroom furniture would be a great place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MaddyA87
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Myer's Hotel for anyone holidaying in Berlin. It's located in Prenzlauer Berg, close to great cafes and restaurants and walking distance to Alexanderplaz. The hotel staff were friendly and obliging. They booked an appointment for us on the internet to visit the reichstag. i would stay there again (although don't use the room phone - it's expensive!)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Putnam74
Reviews.Content: I sometimes wonder about very negative reviews. We stayed at the Myers twice for three days each and found it quite pleasant. The breakfast looked good, but is a bit pricy for us. However, less than half a block away is a cafe on Prenzlauer Allee that serves a delicious breakfast (though they don't open until 9-9:30). The staff was particularly pleasant and helpful, with excellent English skills. The rooms were small by American standards, but not by European standards. We were disappointed there was no mini-fridge in one of our rooms, and there was a charge for using the internet, but those are minor concerns. More important, he rooms were comfortable and quiet (the advantage of a residential street) and overlooked a courtyard. And there was no smell of smoke. The hotel appears to have been renovated recently and was charmingly decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here”
Reviews.Author: lilyhuub
Reviews.Content: It even doesn't deserve 2 stars,what a shame this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OrenmontrealQC
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the website. We stayed here in a pinch and were highly disapointed. We paid $140 euros per night for a very small room which smelled of smoke masked with air freshener, the smell was actually nauseating and we had to leave the windows open for the entire two days we were there! Which made for a terrible nights sleep due to the fact that there was very little space between rooms and the voices carried quite late into the night. The bathroom was not very clean, to be specific there were little black hairs all around the sink by the faucette and the towels had a musty smell. The decor dates back to before the wall came down. On a very small bright note, the people were friendly, the location was good & they had pleanty of selection for breakfast. In conclusion, the value to money ratio is non existant and unless you like sharing the elevator with multiple smokers, this is probably not the place for you either!

Reviews.Title: “not bad,, not great”
Reviews.Author: traveller47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights then moved to Alexander Plaza ( see review). Myer's is located a bit further out in Prenz'lberg and there is really no night life, cafes etc in the immediate vicinity.More like being on a residential block. It is fairly close to Kowllwitz Platz where you will find some good cafes. The room we had was a non smoking but it was on a smoking floor and we were assaulted by smoke coming and going. The room was quite large with skylights but it was impossible to stand upright in the tub/shower due to sloping ceiling. Originally we were on a floor that was completely non smoking but the window was onto a very small interior courtyard/lightwell...rather claustrophobic so the hotel did move us. As mentioned in another review the desk staff is actually off in a small side room..there is a bar off the reception area but again it was filled with smoke. The nearest internet access was about 10 minutes walk in an area that was not very welcoming. Having said all that the breakfast at Myer's was the best we encountered in 3 weeks of travel. Lots of variety, hot eggs, cheeses, fish, assorted fruit juices and served in a very nice room looking out onto a garden. Access by the tram was fairly easy but we felt we were just a bit too far from main sights. The decor was a mix of old and new, hotel was clean. No real problems but would not recommend for tourists with limited time to see Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dallerton53
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the cold wet weather had something to do with it, but I was vaguely disappointed in the hotel. My single room was comfortable with a window overlooking a pleasant garden. The service was OK, reception is sited to the side of the entrance so it looks like there's no-one around to greet you when you arrive. I like a welcoming front desk rather than having to stick my head round a door to get someone's attention. The breakfast room was pleasant with a reasonable choice of the usual breakfast stuffs, cereal, meats, eggs, cheese, juice etc. I liked the area, it was a nice mix of old houses with some modern and sympathetic development work going on. Handy for Alexanderplatz with trams and other U bahns close to hand. I had a very nice , reasonably priced meal in Gugelhof - 5 mins from the hotel, and there was a very pleasant local cafe scene. I would stay in this area again but choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Big, nice rooms, located on a very quiet place. A very kind and helpful staff, excellent breakfast. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. The location near Alexander Platz is good to reach most places in town very fast. Will come again.

HotelInfo.Name: Myer's Hotel - Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Metzer Strasse 26, 10405 Berlin, Germany
